result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reynaldo Trevino III

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel received discovery and requested more time for review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04. Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Reynaldo Trevino not in court, in custody.  Brett Lee Copeland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel. Defense requests more time to review case. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense's motion to withdraw heard. State takes no position. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted. Public Defender's Office notify to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Reynaldo Trevino not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to tag with defendant's case 2021CF710 for motion hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Reynaldo Trevino not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in court by video with Attorney Michael J Steinle who appears in person.  Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019550,
Payable Number: 988751,
Receipt Number: 22RP008208,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Reynaldo Trevino III
Current: 3413 S. 34TH Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2022)
Prior: 1222 Rawson Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Reynaldo Trevino in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
